lead_paragraph: LAVINE--Melvin (Mel), 88, a gifted print and television journalist, died in Berkeley, CA, on July 5. A producer- writer for NBC and CBS News, he was raised in Brookline, MA, and graduated from the University of Maine. He became a reporter for Sanford Maine's Tribune in 1950 and later the Humboldt Times in Eureka, CA. In the 1960s, he was a news anchor for a Eureka TV station before winning a fellowship at Columbia University School of Journalism. In 1964, he joined NBC News in New York, assigned to local programs and The Today Show. In 1978, he switched to CBS's Sunday Morning and Walter Cronkite's documentary unit. Moving in 1991 to Berkeley, he continued as a producer with CBS. Mel's memoir, "A Strange Breed of Folks," is a vivid account of his career. Until his death, he was a columnist for The San Leandro, CA, Times. Predeceased by his first wife, Donna Willbanks, he is survived by his wife, Lorraine (Rainey) Sykes. 1/3
